newsitem.title: ESTONIA: Estonian Savings Bank approves new share issue.
newsitem.headline: Estonian Savings Bank approves new share issue.

text.p: One of the largest banks in Estonia, Savings Bank, on Monday received the backing from its shareholders for an issue of 3.2 million new shares at 33.50 kroons each, the bank said.

Shareholders can buy new shares in proportion to the amount of stock already held, the bank said in a statement. The subscription period runs from October 16 to 30 but can be extended to November 14 if not all the shares are bought.
The bank last week forecast that its consolidated profit this year would be 70 million kroons after a first-half profit of 22.4 million kroons.
